Text saved: Some adventurers today are not happy with just one amazing journey; they like to do one difficult thing after another. For example, Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountain on every continent. She has also cycled across Canada and ran a long race in the Sahara Desert, where the heat was 45ºC. But perhaps her most special journey was a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a glacier, so someone had to rescue her. Most people would have stopped at that point, but Meagan decided to continue. She reached the South Pole forty days later, even though she had to pull a sled with her tent and all her food behind her through very cold weather and ice storms.
